Direct every operation toward a clearly defined, decisive, and attainable objective.
Seize, retain, and exploit the initiative.
Concentrate combat power at the decisive place and time.
Allocate minimum essential combat power to secondary efforts.
Place the enemy in a disadvantageous position through flexible application of combat power.
One responsible commander for every objective.
Never permit the enemy to acquire unexpected advantage.
Strike at a time, place, or manner for which the enemy is unprepared.
Prepare clear, uncomplicated plans and orders.

Warfighting. Marine Corps doctrine; clearest articulation of maneuver warfare philosophy. 75 pages.
Attack enemy cohesion and will rather than destroying forces through attrition. Exploit weakness, avoid strength.
